title: Define Project Scope and Requirements - Updated
description: This RFC outlines the gathering and documentation of detailed requirements for the CTFScoreboardSystem. The focus areas include user roles and permissions, real-time scoring and leaderboard updates, challenge management, team management, submission handling, analytics/reporting, data storage, security, privacy, and non-functional requirements such as availability, reliability, and maintainability. Interviews or workshops may be conducted with key stakeholders, including contest organizers, players, and administrators to ensure a comprehensive understanding of their expectations and constraints. The overall system architecture will be defined, and potential integration points with external systems or data sources will be identified. Upon completion, this task will serve as the foundation for the development process.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall system architecture, including the components, data flow, and communication protocols between different parts of the system.

title: Design Database Schema
description: Design the database schema to store and manage competition data, including teams, challenges, scores, and other relevant information.

title: Develop Backend Services
description: Implement the backend services for managing competitions, handling real-time score updates, and providing data to the frontend.

title: Develop Frontend User Interface
description: Design and implement the user interface for the scoreboard and analytics platform, including real-time score updates and data visualization.

title: Implement Security Measures
description: Ensure the system is secure by implementing appropriate security measures, such as authentication, authorization, and data encryption.

title: Set up Continuous Integration and Deployment
description: Configure a CI/CD pipeline for automated building, testing, and deployment of the application to different environments.

title: Write Documentation
description: Create comprehensive documentation for the system, including installation guides, user manuals, and developer documentation.

title: Test and Quality Assurance
description: Plan and execute thorough testing of the system, including unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests, to ensure high quality and reliability.
